qas.question: What country did President Frankiln Roosevelt have a good neighbor policy for in hopes of a better relationship?
In what year did a federal judge say that three immigrants from Mexico were not eligible to be citizens because of their race?
What US President wanted to treat Hispanic people as white by the federal government?
People of what descent were classified as white by the federal government at the suggestion of President Roosevelt?
In 1935, what race was a person required to be to become a United States citizen?

context: President Franklin D. Roosevelt promoted a "good neighbor" policy that sought better relations with <a0_0>Mexico<a0_0/>. In <a1_0>1935<a1_0/> a federal judge ruled that three Mexican immigrants were ineligible for citizenship because they were not <a4_0>white<a4_0/>, as required by federal law. Mexico protested, and <a2_0>Roosevelt<a2_0/> decided to circumvent the decision and make sure the federal government treated Hispanics as white. The State Department, the Census Bureau, the Labor Department, and other government agencies therefore made sure to uniformly classify people of <a3_0>Mexican<a3_0/> descent as white. This policy encouraged the League of United Latin American Citizens in its quest to minimize discrimination by asserting their whiteness.
